remarks: Definition of a compact topology.  A topology is compact iff any open covering of its underlying set contains a finite sub-covering (Heine-Borel property).  Definition C''' of [BourbakiTop1] p.  I.59. Note:  Bourbaki uses the term quasi-compact topology but it is not the modern usage (which we follow).  (Contributed by FL, 22-Dec-2008.)
